page.title: 18ARROW
page.content: Arrow is a small hamlet on the outskirts of Alcester.It was named in the old Domesday record and is worthy of note now. It contains{Arrow Mill,} already noted in our text. { The Toll House.}This stands on the corner of the Worcester turn. Until 1860 gates barred the road, left, to Evesham, and right, to Worcester. This house is still standing but is now a private residence. {The Elephant Tree.}On the right hand side coming out of Alcester, approaching Arrow Toll House is the locally well known elephant tree.It is a very old oak tree and its base and roots have taken the shape of an elephant.The bark looks every bit like an elephant hide.The age is unknown but a local man aged 72 years old says it has always been there.
